channel.title: "A" Is for Abraham
channel.description: A lively discussion on various topics related to faith, organised around the alphabet, featuring Rabbi Adam Zagoria-Moffet of St Albans Masorti Synagogue, Fr. Richard Watson, Vicar of St Saviour's Church in St Albans, and Akhtar Zaman, President of the Islamic Centre of St. Albans. Three faiths, one family.

item.title: "B" is for Beginnings
item.description: Join Adam, Akhtar and Richard as they discuss 'Beginnings' in their traditions. What's the point of Creation stories, and what can we learn from them? Do science and faith have to be at odds over the foundation of the Universe or its functioning? This and more on our second episode in which we go back to the beginning.

item.description: In our first episode we look at our titular hero, Abraham/Avraham/Ibrahim. Father to all three of our faiths and model of religious life – who is Abraham to us and why might he be the key to successful interfaith dialogue.
